sentences.sContent: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.sCn: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

sentences.sContent: ...but the high reputation for its historical culture...
...M: You’ve established reputation in international banking circles...
...The UK enjoys an eXcellent reputation around the world for the high quality of our education system...
...Attracting the brightest and most ambitious postgraduate and research students is critical if the UK is to maintain its quality reputation for research...
...Why does British food have a reputation for being so bad...
...cheating can hurt the reputation of the university and harm those who worked hard for their degree...
...why exactly does your job have a reputation for being stressful...
...Apparently the boy had a longstanding reputation for bad behaviour and his mum for even worse behaviour if he was challenged...

phrases.pCn: 由(或通过)名声；由于知名度
vt. 出名因（因…而著称）；有…的好名声

remMethod.val: re(重新) ＋ put(想) ＋ ation(表状态) → 重新想想， 名气只是过眼烟云 → 名气， 名声

words.tran: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
名誉好的；被普遍认为…的
认为（repute的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past
